result.execSummary:
The defendant Janice A. Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: - $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
- May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

- Absolute Sobriety.  
- No controlled substances without a prescription.  
- Not to have contact with J.R.M. or his/her residence unless otherwise approved by agent.  
- Defendant is allowed one trip with Law Enforcement to residence to obtain personal belongings.
- Not to have contact with Dragonfly Mini Storage located at 487 State Highway 46, Amery, WI. 
- Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting.
- May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
- If not a U.S. citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

**Per court order on 3/31/22,  the no contact condition with M.K.H. or his/her residence is removed. **

- Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.
- Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
- Banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.  
-  Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.
*Per Court Order on 3/21/22, 90 days of jail time is to be released and served. Start date determined by the Department of Corrections.

CASES: 21CF572, 21CF616, 22CF22, 22CF23 & 21FO463.  11:33 AM Defendant Janice A. Fisher in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Defendant Janice A. Fisher in custody.  Benjamin James Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk.
21CF572-Count 2-crim damage w/ repeater- guilty plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
Count 3-crim trespass w/ repeater-guilty plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
All other counts DRI

22CF23-Count 3-poss meth w/ repeater-guilty plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
All other counts DRI

21CF616-DRI
22CF22-DRI
21FO463-dismissed

CT finds def waiving PSI.  

SENTENCE: 

21CF572-
Count 2-crim damage-w/h, probation up to 2 yrs.  AODA, AS, no controlled substances.  Not to have contact with JRM or his residence - subject to approval by probation.  Allowed 1 trip w/ LE to obtain personal items.  Not to have contact with MKH or her residence or Dragonfly Mini Storage, 487 State Hwy 46, Amery, WI.  NC with users/dealers.  4 days credit.  DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $265.60 fine.  60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment.  Restitution is held open for a pd of 60 days for filing.  30 days to respond. 

Count 3-crim trespass-w/h, probation up to 2 yrs.  AODA, AS, no controlled substances.  Not to have contact with JRM or his residence - subject to approval by probation.  Allowed 1 trip w/ LE to obtain personal items.  Not to have contact with MKH or her residence or Dragonfly Mini Storage, 487 State Hwy 46, Amery, WI.  NC with users/dealers.  DNA sample, $200 surcharge, no fine.

22CF23-Count 3-poss meth-w/h, probation up to 2 yrs.  AODA, AS, no controlled substances.  Not to have contact with JRM or his residence - subject to approval by probation.  Allowed 1 trip w/ LE to obtain personal items.  Not to have contact with MKH or her residence or Dragonfly Mini Storage, 487 State Hwy 46, Amery, WI.  NC with users/dealers.  21 days credit.   6 mo CT, subj to WR, no GT-stayed.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge, no fine.  60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment.  May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.  Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

PCR.  11:59 am adj.
Plea hearing on February 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.

CASES 21CF572, 21CF616, 22CF22, 22CF23, 21FO463. 09:30 am. JL-Clerk. Defendant Janice A. Fisher in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Defendant Janice A. Fisher in custody. Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. 

21CF572, 51CF616, 22CF22, 22CF23 - PH: Def waives PH. CT accepts waiver. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. ARGN: Reading waived, plea NG to all counts on all cases. DST on all 4 cases. Defense is preserved 15 days on prearraginment rights on all cases. 
21FO463 - Plea NG, continue to track with CF cases. Notice to be sent to village prosecutor so dismissal can be addressed at next hearing since charges are similar to those in 21CF572.
21CF616/21CF572 - CT amends bond to cover both cases as that was the original intent. All conditions to remain the same. Bonds cont. 9:41 am adj.
